Class representing a GL Buffer.

◆ setData()

template<typename T >
void rev::GLBuffer::setData ( const std::vector< T > &  vec,
size_t  access = size_t(GL::RangeBufferAccessFlag::kInvalidateBuffer | GL::RangeBufferAccessFlag::kWrite) 
)
inline

Set data from a vector of inputs.

The GL_MAP_INVALIDATE_BUFFER_BIT is apparently very helpful for write performance

Note
This maps the buffer, which requires an unmap. SubData is recommended instead

Substitutes data into the buffer, no mapping or unmapping required.

[in]offsetoffset in number of elements T from the start of the buffer

Member Data Documentation

◆ m_bindingPoint

unsigned int rev::GLBuffer::m_bindingPoint = std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::max()
protected

The binding point of the buffer.

Binding point won't change for GL buffers, but may be dynamic for other buffers
